reg:regulation.reg:title:
Single-Use and Plastic Waste Prevention Regulation
B.C. Reg. 254/2023

bcl:schedule.bcl:lefttext: On the recommendation of the undersigned, the Lieutenant Governor, by and with the advice and consent of the Executive Council, orders as follows:
bcl:schedule.bcl:indent2: (b) effective December 20, 2023, the attached Single-Use and Plastic Waste Prevention Regulation is made and comes into force as follows:
bcl:schedule.bcl:indent3: (ii) Parts 2 and 3 and section 11 are brought into force on July 15, 2024.

bcl:section.bcl:text: In this Part, oxo-degradable plastic means a plastic that contains an additive that, through oxidation, leads to chemical decomposition or to the fragmentation of the plastic material into microfragments.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Prohibition on packaging and single-use products composed of oxo-degradable plastic

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A business operator must not distribute or sell packaging, or a single-use product, that is wholly or partly composed of oxo-degradable plastic.
The prohibition in subsection (1) does not apply to any of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a device as defined in the Pharmaceutical Services Act;
packaging or a single-use product intended for sale or distribution to a person outside British Columbia.

bcl:definition.bcl:text: food service provider means a person who, in the ordinary course of business, prepares and serves food or beverages to individuals;
prepare, when used in relation to food or beverages, means cook, slice, chop, mix, brew, squeeze or otherwise make ready to eat or drink;
product includes prepared food or beverages that are purchased for takeout or delivery;
recycled paper bag means a paper bag

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: that is composed of at least 40% recycled paper content, and
on the outside of which is printed a reference to the applicable percentage of recycled content and the word "recyclable";

bcl:definition.bcl:text: reusable bag means a bag that is manufactured to be used and machine-washed at least 100 times;
shopping bag means a bag that is distributed or sold for the purpose described in section 5;
used bag means a bag that has been previously used and is being reused.

bcl:section.bcl:text: Except as authorized under this Part, a business operator must not distribute or sell a bag for the purpose of facilitating the transport of a commodity or product, that is distributed or sold by the business operator, from the business operator's place of business.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Shopping bags sold for a charge

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A business operator may sell a shopping bag if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the shopping bag is a recycled paper bag or reusable bag, and
the customer purchasing the shopping bag pays a charge for the bag, as follows:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: at least $0.25 for each recycled paper bag;
at least $2.00 for each reusable bag.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A shopping bag may not be sold under subsection (1) unless

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the customer is offered, orally or in writing, an opportunity to use the customer's own bag,
the customer chooses to purchase a shopping bag, and
before the sale, the customer is informed of the amount of the charge for the shopping bag.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The business operator must include, as a separate line item, on any receipt given to the customer, the amount charged under subsection (1).

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Shopping bags distributed free of charge
bcl:section.bcl:text: A business operator may distribute a shopping bag without imposing a charge for the bag if any of the following apply:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the bag is a used bag;
the bag is a paper bag that is less than 15 cm by 20 cm when flat;
the bag is a recycled paper bag and is distributed to facilitate the transport of any of the following:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: a drug specified in Schedule I, IA, II or III of the Drug Schedules Regulation;
a device as defined in the Pharmaceutical Services Act;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the business operator is a food service provider, and the bag is a recycled paper bag that is distributed for any of the following purposes:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: to facilitate the transport of food or beverages that are

bcl:clause.bcl:text: prepared by the business operator, and

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: to contain prepared food or beverages served to a customer through a window at a drive-through restaurant;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the bag

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: is a recycled paper bag, reusable bag or used bag, and

contains food, beverages or personal hygiene products that are to be provided directly or indirectly to an individual for free or at reduced cost by a society or by a registered charity as defined in section 248 (1) of the Income Tax Act (Canada).

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Requirement to keep records — shopping bags

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section, "large business operator" means a business operator that employs 500 or more employees in British Columbia.

In determining the number of employees for the purpose of subsection (1), if the business operator is operating under a franchise agreement, the business operator, the franchisor and the other parties with whom the franchisor has a franchise agreement in relation to the same product are deemed to be a single business operator.
A large business operator must keep, and make available for inspection under subsection (4), records of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the average number of recycled paper bags sold by the large business operator per sale transaction in each of the previous 2 calendar years;
the average number of reusable bags sold by the large business operator per sale transaction in each of the previous 2 calendar years.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: An officer may inspect records kept under subsection (3).

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Restriction on food service ware composed of prohibited material

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A food service provider must not distribute or sell food or beverages if the food or beverages are

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: prepared by the food service provider for takeout, delivery or immediate consumption, and
contained or packaged in food service ware that is wholly or partly composed of a class A prohibited material.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The prohibition in subsection (1) does not apply to any of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: food service ware that is wholly composed of paper or a plant fibre material and lined with compostable plastic;
food or beverages intended for sale or distribution to a person outside British Columbia;
film wrap that is wholly composed of polyvinyl chloride.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A business operator must not distribute or sell food or beverages that are contained or packaged in food service ware that is wholly or partly composed of a class B prohibited material.
The prohibition in subsection (3) does not apply to any of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: food or beverages intended for sale or distribution to a person outside British Columbia;
film wrap that is wholly composed of polyvinyl chloride;
a tray that is wholly composed of polystyrene foam and used to contain any of the following types of food, whether fresh or frozen:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: raw fish in a state not ready to be eaten.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A business operator must not distribute or sell food service ware that is wholly or partly composed of a class B prohibited material.
The prohibition in subsection (5) does not apply to any of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: food service ware intended for sale or distribution to a person outside British Columbia;
food service ware sold or distributed to a business operator for the purpose of containing or packaging food or beverages intended for sale to a person outside British Columbia;
film wrap that is wholly composed of polyvinyl chloride;
a tray that is wholly composed of polystyrene foam and sold or distributed to a business operator for the purpose of containing any of the following types of food, whether fresh or frozen:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: raw fish in a state not ready to be eaten.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: This subsection and subsections (2) (c), (4) (b) and (6) (c) are repealed on July 1, 2028.
This subsection and subsections (4) (c) and (6) (d) are repealed on July 1, 2030.
For certainty, the prohibitions in this section are in addition to the prohibition in section 3.
